item.title: Calling for the immediate release of Brittney Griner, a citizen of the United States, who was wrongfully detained by the Government of the Russian Federation in February 2022.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1204, H. Res. 1132 is considered passed House. (consideration: CR H5892; text: CR H5892)

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 203 (Roll no. 298). (text: CR H5883)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 203 (Roll no. 298).
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 204 (Roll no. 297). (consideration: CR H5883-5915)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1204.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5883-5915)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 84.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-385, by Mr. McGovern.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-385, by Mr. McGovern.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendments to the House amendment to the bill (S. 2938) to designate the United States Courthouse and Federal Building located at 111 North Adams Street in Tallahassee, Florida, as the "Joseph Woodrow Hatchett United States Courthouse and Federal Building", and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the bill (S. 2089) to amend the Families First Coronavirus Response Act to extend child nutrition waiver authority, and for other purposes; relating to consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 4346) making appropriations for Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
